captions.text:
Yeah.
He can't do that to our pledges.

Only we can do that
to our pledges.

Redo those buttons.
Dress that belt buckle.

Straighten that cap. And goddamn it,
tuck up those pajamas.
What's that on your chest, mister?

It's a pledge pin, sir.
A pledge pin?

Just tell me, mister.
What fraternity would pledge a...

You'll report to the stable tonight
and every night at 1900 hours...

Your left arm is straight,
but you're not keeping your head down.
Always try to hit through the ball.
I gotta work on my game.

No, no, no.
Don't think of it as work.

The whole point
is just to enjoy yourself.

title: Animal House (3/10) Movie CLIP - Only We Can Do That to Our Pledges (1978) HD

comments.text:
I noticed in the movie "The Twilight Zone" (the episode with the racist 
being thrown through time to Nazi Germany, the racist South, then to 
Vietnam), in the Vietnam scene he is in the jungle and sees an American 
platoon coming towards him, he calls out to them and they in turn all shoot 
their weapons in every direction, after they are done shooting one of the 
soldiers says "I told you guys we shouldn't have shot Lt. 
Neidermeyer!"...that episode was directed by John Landis, remember at the 
end of "Animal House" when it says Neidermeyer was killed by his own troops 
in Vietnam?﻿

comments.text:
How many think 'Animal House' is the funniest movie ever made? I think it 
gets my vote! This scene, Otter's defense at the student court, the ending 
scene with all the chaos in the streets, the toga party, shopping in the 
grocery store, Otter making it with the dean's wife, zero point zero GPA 
for Bluto, it's a zit, the fraternity rushing scene - all these scenes get 
me every time!

comments.text:
Oldest trick in the book. In the first shot, the golf ball is hit, but it 
just has to fly in the horse's general direction. In the second shot, the 
close-up on the horse's ass, the ball is thrown in from just out of frame. 
Same for the shots with the soup pot and the window.

comments.author: Neilrrc37

comments.text:
This was filmed just up the street from where I live. The whole movie was 
filmed in this area. AND... OTIS DAY played this past weekend (3 sold out 
shows), at The Dexter Lake Club Roadhouse. Otis hasn't been there since the 
filming in '77. What an awesome show. He will be back at The Dexter Lake 
Club for dates in 2013. It will be worth traveling to come to the show(s) 
that are coming up.... to see Otis play at the place that started it all.

comments.text:
I wasn't even born yet when this movie came out. My Dad & my younger sister 
showed it to me & I thought it was funny. A far better movie than Van 
Wilder (also made my National Lampoon) in my opinion. 1 of my favorite (& 
most memorable lines) 1:25 Neidermeyer: "A PLEDGE PIN? ON YOUR UNIFORM?" 
Because of this movie, I got to see what character the father & the teacher 
(played by Mark Metcalfe) in 2 Twisted Sister videos were based on.
